intro: Balsamea schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian balsam, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
